instruction: Rank candidates for a Backend / Tech Lead role with focus on leadership and years of experience.

input.question: Which candidate is better prepared for a Backend Tech Lead position?

context.text: 12 years of software engineering, 10 relevant, Tech Lead and mentoring roles, English C1, Spanish Native.
Frontend developer with React/Next.js, 3 years experience, English B2, migration AngularJS→Next.js.

ranked_candidates.reason: 12 years of backend/software engineering, Tech Lead experience, strong English (C1).
Solid React/Next.js skills but less backend/leadership experience.

output.notes: Mauro is stronger for Backend/Tech Lead; Jeronimo is more frontend-oriented.

instruction: Filter candidates by English proficiency, return only those with C1 or higher.

input.question: Who has the strongest English level?

context.text: English Advanced (CEF C1), Spanish Native.
English: B2, daily standups in English.

instruction: Verify leadership experience with evidence such as Tech Lead roles or mentoring activities.

input.question: Which candidate has verifiable leadership or mentoring experience?

context.text: Technical Leadership: Very High; Mentoring: Very High; Explicitly stated in title and description.
Frontend React/Next.js developer; no mention of mentoring or leadership.

instruction: Rank .NET candidates by microservices and Azure experience.

input.question: Top candidates for .NET microservices on Azure?

context.text: .NET Core, microservices, Azure Functions, 8 years.
Python, TensorFlow, NLP, APIs in Flask.

instruction: Filter candidates with EF Core + SQL Server experience.

input.question: Who covers EF Core + SQL Server well?

context.text: 6 years EF Core, SQL Server tuning, Dapper.
7 years Django ORM, PostgreSQL, Celery.

ranked_candidates.reason: Direct EF Core + SQL Server experience.

output.notes: Mariano is Python/Postgres, not EF Core.

instruction: Rank candidates by CI/CD expertise specifically in Azure DevOps.

input.question: Who can own CI/CD pipelines in Azure DevOps?

context.text: Azure DevOps pipelines YAML, release gates, SonarCloud, coverage 80%.
PHP/Laravel, Jenkins pipelines, artifact storage.

ranked_candidates.reason: CI experience in Jenkins, not Azure DevOps.

output.notes: Diego is a direct fit for Azure DevOps.

instruction: Verify DDD/CQRS experience.

input.question: Any candidate with DDD and CQRS in .NET?

context.text: DDD tactical/strategic, CQRS with MediatR, Outbox pattern.
Spring Boot monolith, MVC, no CQRS.

instruction: Filter by messaging experience (RabbitMQ/Kafka).

input.question: Who has production messaging with retries and DLQs?

context.text: RabbitMQ consumers, retries, dead-letter queues, idempotency keys.
Basic REST APIs, no messaging queues.

ranked_candidates.reason: Clear experience with queues and resilience.

instruction: Verify modern authentication (JWT/OAuth2) experience.

input.question: Who implemented OAuth2/OIDC flows?

context.text: JWT, refresh tokens, OAuth2 PKCE, microservice-level scopes.
Sessions with cookies, basic authentication.

instruction: Rank by automated testing maturity.

input.question: Who drives testing strategy in .NET?

context.text: xUnit, Moq, contract tests, test pyramid guidelines.
Manual QA only, no unit tests.

instruction: Filter candidates with distributed caching experience.

input.question: Need Redis experience in .NET.

context.text: StackExchange.Redis, key design, expirations, cache-aside.
Local in-process MemoryCache only.

output.notes: Sebastian only uses in-memory local cache.

instruction: Rank by high-performance API skills.

input.question: Who can optimize .NET APIs for performance?

context.text: Kestrel tuning, connection pooling, Span<T>, benchmarks.
Basic CRUD APIs without optimization.

ranked_candidates.reason: Focus on performance and low-level tuning.

instruction: Verify observability stack adoption.

input.question: Looking for structured logging and tracing.

context.text: Serilog, OpenTelemetry traces/metrics, correlation IDs.
Console logs only, no structure.

instruction: Filter by containerization and Kubernetes experience.

input.question: Who has production k8s deployments for .NET?

context.text: Docker multi-stage, Helm charts, readiness/liveness probes.
Deploys on IIS on-prem, no containers.

instruction: Filter by serverless event processing on Azure.

input.question: Azure Functions real-time events?

context.text: Functions triggers, bindings, Durable Functions, real-time scaling.
CRON in Windows Service for nightly jobs.

ranked_candidates.reason: Direct experience with Azure Functions and scaling.

output.notes: Leo uses Windows Services, not serverless.

instruction: Verify payments and security exposure (PCI-like).

input.question: Any candidate with secure payment integrations?

context.text: Tokenization, hashing, secret rotation, audits.
Cart and orders, no mention of PCI/security.

output.notes: Tomas has no advanced security controls.

instruction: Rank by staff-level leadership impact.

input.question: Who can lead as Staff Engineer?

context.text: Staff .NET engineer, guidelines, PR templates, mentoring, architecture reviews.
Individual contributor, no leadership activities listed.

instruction: Filter by cloud experience focusing on Azure PaaS.

input.question: Who has Azure PaaS (App Service, Functions, Service Bus)?

context.text: Azure Functions, Service Bus, App Service, Key Vault.
EF Core and SQL Server on-prem.

ranked_candidates.reason: Strong use of Azure PaaS services.

output.notes: Sofia is more focused on on-prem DB.

instruction: Verify microservices fundamentals (idempotency, retries, circuit breakers).

input.question: Who demonstrates resilience patterns?

context.text: Idempotent consumers, retries, DLQs.
Performance tuning in Kestrel and Span<T>.

output.notes: Juan Pablo is strong in performance, not resilience.

instruction: Rank candidates by security practices (OWASP, secrets).

input.question: Who enforces secure coding in .NET?

context.text: OWASP checks, secret rotation, vaults.
Basic CRUD without explicit controls.

output.notes: Paula has no explicit security focus.

instruction: Filter by data layer patterns and ORMs in .NET.

input.question: Who has advanced ORM usage?

context.text: EF Core, Dapper, performance tuning, indexes.
Django ORM, not .NET ORMs.

ranked_candidates.reason: Strong in EF Core and Dapper.

instruction: Rank for .NET + OAuth/OIDC integrations with third parties.

input.question: Who can integrate secure third-party auth?

context.text: OAuth2/OIDC with PKCE, multi-tenant scopes.
Session cookies; basic auth flows.

instruction: Filter by logging/metrics stack completeness.

input.question: Serilog + OpenTelemetry present?

context.text: Serilog structured logs, OpenTelemetry traces/metrics.
Console logs only.

instruction: Verify container best practices (multi-stage, health checks).

input.question: Who builds production-grade images?

context.text: Docker multi-stage, health probes, non-root user.
IIS deployments only.

instruction: Rank for event-driven processing on Azure.

input.question: Who can deliver real-time event pipelines?

context.text: Triggers, bindings, Durable orchestration.
CRON-like schedulers on Windows Service.

instruction: Filter by payments domain knowledge.

input.question: Who handled PCI-like constraints?

context.text: Tokenization, secret rotation, audit trails.
Basic orders/payments integration, no PCI mention.

instruction: Verify staff-level mentorship and review processes.

input.question: Who runs effective PR reviews and mentorship?

context.text: Guidelines, PR templates, mentorship, architecture councils.
Solo contributor, individual delivery.

instruction: Rank for high-availability patterns (circuit breaker, timeouts).

input.question: Who has used resilience libraries in .NET?

context.text: Polly for retries/circuit breakers, idempotent consumers.
Basic CRUD, no resilience libraries.

instruction: Filter for database performance tuning responsibilities.

input.question: Who tuned SQL Server performance?

context.text: Index tuning, execution plans, EF Core performance.
Local cache only, no SQL Server work.

instruction: Verify experience with code quality gates.

input.question: Who enforces quality gates in CI?

context.text: SonarCloud, coverage minimums, PR checks in Azure DevOps.
Builds in Jenkins; no formal gates.

instruction: Rank by fit for Backend .NET role (exclude primarily frontend).

input.question: Who is a better fit for backend .NET?

context.text: Tech Lead / Backend focus, C1 English.
React/Next.js, frontend UI work, B2 English.

instruction: Filter by API security (JWT scopes + refresh).

input.question: Candidates with JWT scopes & refresh strategy?

context.text: JWT scopes, refresh tokens, token rotation.
Cookie sessions, no JWT.

instruction: Verify log correlation across services.

input.question: Who correlates logs/traces end-to-end?

context.text: Correlation IDs propagated in OpenTelemetry + Serilog.
Logs without correlation IDs.

instruction: Rank by readiness to migrate monolith to microservices in .NET.

input.question: Who can lead a monolith→microservices migration?

context.text: DDD, CQRS, outbox; migrations by bounded contexts.
Spring Boot monolith, no microservices.

instruction: Filter by real-time processing skills.

input.question: Who has low-latency event processing?

context.text: Event-driven with scaling and Durable orchestration.
Nightly scheduled jobs in Windows Services.

instruction: Verify mentoring/coaching evidence.

input.question: Any proof of mentoring activities?

context.text: Mentoring: Very High; team coaching.
IC without leadership or mentoring.
